Here are 5 things that citizens can do to help this effort to keep our families at home: 1-Participate in Retraining programs, 2-Increase education, 3-Learn how to expand your business, 4-Dare to be Entrepreneurs, 5-Support development of infrastructure. #ruralbizsummit pic.twitter.com/jFE6zfC82N

The people in rural Utah know how to work hard and work smart, which is what is needed. It will take a joint effort to make economic growth happen here in our rural communities. As individuals, institutions & companies in rural Utah there is much that can be done. #ruralbizsummit

I‚Äôve talked to many people in our rural counties & most of them tell me that they want to stay here. They love the life they have here & want their children to live here & their grandchildren. To do this, we must have good jobs available‚Äîjobs that pay enough to support a family.

In deciding to create the #ruralbizsummit we thought of 5 specific areas that could promote economic development: 1-Transport rural workers to the Wasatch front, 2-Remote workers, 3-Expand Wasatch front businesses into rural Utah, 4-Expand local companies, & 5-Be an Entrepreneur pic.twitter.com/8MWHNhRZjd

I want to find ways to help rural businesses prosper & make a dent in the high unemployment. @GovHerbert & @BusinessUtah have already made great strides in this area with their 25K Jobs Initiative and other programs. Some of these efforts will be showcased today. #ruralbizsummit

I quickly learned that the concerns in our rural counties are very different from those along the Wasatch front. Early on, I made it one of my primary missions, to do what I could to bring some success to the rural areas of our district. #ruralbizsummit

I have held over 100 town hall meetings all over the district‚Äîincluding dozens of visits to the rural counties‚Äîwhich I have found to be very helpful in understanding what concerns exist in the district. I work for you and need your input to be effective. #ruralbizsummit
